text: you know I didn't have this one on my bingo card I really thought today GameStop was going to crack above 25 it was oh so very close and we ended up closing today at 2497 close very close but not quite spend most of the day above that handle can't help but find that slightly interesting now another interesting component to this though is the fact that we were bumping up against the point of control for the volume profile which is what this is here it just tells me where we were transacting the most with in a specific time frame in this case a 3-month daily there's a lot of people that are holding shares right now at 2644 like somewhere around there and if we go out to 6 months it's kind of right around that same exact period 2648 is and then if we go out to a year you'll notice it's still very close to that 2662 the reason why that matters so much is because a lot of times when you look at different time frames you'll actually see the point of control move around as people are buying at all different kinds of time frames this doesn't surprise me to see a lot of selling happening as we get up to this point of control because for a lot of people this is where they've been holding for a pretty prolong period of time and some people are trying to get out
